availableChallenges.title: Case Closed
availableChallenges.description: Congratulations, Detective! You've solved the case. The stolen formula was for calculating the volume of a cylinder. Professor Euler's prototype has radius 5 cm and height 12 cm. What's its volume? Express as kπ (e.g., 300π).

availableChallenges.title: The Mastermind's Identity
availableChallenges.description: You've gathered all clues! The mastermind's secret number is: (Age from clue 3) × (Missing angle from clue 6) ÷ (Slope from clue 4). Calculate their identification number!

availableChallenges.title: The Final Distance
availableChallenges.description: The Professor's secret lab is hidden underground! From the crime scene, go 9 meters north and 12 meters east. What's the direct distance to the entrance?

availableChallenges.title: The Secret Pattern
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler left a coded sequence: 7, 12, 17, 22, ... What is the 8th term? This arithmetic sequence holds the key to his research location!

availableChallenges.title: The Compound Conspiracy
availableChallenges.description: The suspect's offshore account started with $5000 and grew at 8% compounded annually for 3 years. Calculate the final amount to track their wealth.

availableChallenges.title: The Ransom Money
availableChallenges.description: The stolen research was worth $2000. If invested at 6% simple interest for 4 years, how much interest would it have earned? This might be the thief's motive!

availableChallenges.title: The Evidence Locker
availableChallenges.description: Evidence weights (grams): 45, 23, 67, 34, 45, 78, 23. Find the median weight to organize the evidence locker.

availableChallenges.title: The Probability of Guilt
availableChallenges.description: In the suspect database: 3 have criminal records, 7 have alibis, 5 are missing. What's the probability of randomly selecting someone with a criminal record? Submit as a simplified fraction.

availableChallenges.title: The Footprint Area
availableChallenges.description: CSI found a muddy footprint! It's trapezoidal with parallel sides of 12 cm and 8 cm, and height 15 cm. Calculate the area to match it with suspect shoe sizes.

availableChallenges.title: The Triangular Clue
availableChallenges.description: Hidden in the lab, you find a triangular piece of paper with two angles marked: 42° and 63°. The third angle contains the next clue!

availableChallenges.title: The Hidden Safe
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler hid his most important research in a safe. The combination is the positive solution to x2 − 7x + 12 = 0.

availableChallenges.title: The Getaway Route
availableChallenges.description: Security cameras tracked the suspect from the museum (2, 5) to the parking lot (8, 17). Calculate the slope of their escape route.

availableChallenges.title: The Suspect's Age
availableChallenges.description: A witness says: "The suspect's age plus 12 equals three times their age minus 8." Solve for the suspect's age: x + 12 = 3x − 8

availableChallenges.title: Decoding the Timestamp
availableChallenges.description: The security system shows a coded timestamp: 4 × (7 + 3) − 23. Decode this to find what hour (in 24h format) the break-in occurred.

availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler left a coded sequence: 7, 12, 17, 22, ... What is the 8th term? This arithmetic sequence holds the key to his research location!

availableChallenges.title: The Compound Conspiracy
availableChallenges.description: The suspect's offshore account started with $5000 and grew at 8% compounded annually for 3 years. Calculate the final amount to track their wealth.

availableChallenges.title: The Ransom Money
availableChallenges.description: The stolen research was worth $2000. If invested at 6% simple interest for 4 years, how much interest would it have earned? This might be the thief's motive!

availableChallenges.title: The Evidence Locker
availableChallenges.description: Evidence weights (grams): 45, 23, 67, 34, 45, 78, 23. Find the median weight to organize the evidence locker.

availableChallenges.title: The Probability of Guilt
availableChallenges.description: In the suspect database: 3 have criminal records, 7 have alibis, 5 are missing. What's the probability of randomly selecting someone with a criminal record? Submit as a simplified fraction.

availableChallenges.title: The Footprint Area
availableChallenges.description: CSI found a muddy footprint! It's trapezoidal with parallel sides of 12 cm and 8 cm, and height 15 cm. Calculate the area to match it with suspect shoe sizes.

availableChallenges.title: The Triangular Clue
availableChallenges.description: Hidden in the lab, you find a triangular piece of paper with two angles marked: 42° and 63°. The third angle contains the next clue!

availableChallenges.title: The Hidden Safe
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler hid his most important research in a safe. The combination is the positive solution to x2 − 7x + 12 = 0.

availableChallenges.title: The Getaway Route
availableChallenges.description: Security cameras tracked the suspect from the museum (2, 5) to the parking lot (8, 17). Calculate the slope of their escape route.

availableChallenges.title: The Suspect's Age
availableChallenges.description: A witness says: "The suspect's age plus 12 equals three times their age minus 8." Solve for the suspect's age: x + 12 = 3x − 8

availableChallenges.title: Decoding the Timestamp
availableChallenges.description: The security system shows a coded timestamp: 4 × (7 + 3) − 23. Decode this to find what hour (in 24h format) the break-in occurred.

availableChallenges.title: The Evidence Locker
availableChallenges.description: Evidence weights (grams): 45, 23, 67, 34, 45, 78, 23. Find the median weight to organize the evidence locker.

availableChallenges.title: The Probability of Guilt
availableChallenges.description: In the suspect database: 3 have criminal records, 7 have alibis, 5 are missing. What's the probability of randomly selecting someone with a criminal record? Submit as a simplified fraction.

availableChallenges.title: The Footprint Area
availableChallenges.description: CSI found a muddy footprint! It's trapezoidal with parallel sides of 12 cm and 8 cm, and height 15 cm. Calculate the area to match it with suspect shoe sizes.

availableChallenges.title: The Triangular Clue
availableChallenges.description: Hidden in the lab, you find a triangular piece of paper with two angles marked: 42° and 63°. The third angle contains the next clue!

availableChallenges.title: The Hidden Safe
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler hid his most important research in a safe. The combination is the positive solution to x2 − 7x + 12 = 0.

availableChallenges.title: The Getaway Route
availableChallenges.description: Security cameras tracked the suspect from the museum (2, 5) to the parking lot (8, 17). Calculate the slope of their escape route.

availableChallenges.title: The Suspect's Age
availableChallenges.description: A witness says: "The suspect's age plus 12 equals three times their age minus 8." Solve for the suspect's age: x + 12 = 3x − 8

availableChallenges.title: Decoding the Timestamp
availableChallenges.description: The security system shows a coded timestamp: 4 × (7 + 3) − 23. Decode this to find what hour (in 24h format) the break-in occurred.

availableChallenges.title: The Crime Scene
availableChallenges.description: Detective, you arrive at Professor Euler's lab to find chaos! There are 15 books scattered, 8 papers torn, and 3 coffee cups spilled. To access the security footage, enter the total number of disturbed items.

availableChallenges.title: Case Closed
availableChallenges.description: Congratulations, Detective! You've solved the case. The stolen formula was for calculating the volume of a cylinder. Professor Euler's prototype has radius 5 cm and height 12 cm. What's its volume? Express as kπ (e.g., 300π).

availableChallenges.title: The Mastermind's Identity
availableChallenges.description: You've gathered all clues! The mastermind's secret number is: (Age from clue 3) × (Missing angle from clue 6) ÷ (Slope from clue 4). Calculate their identification number!

availableChallenges.title: The Final Distance
availableChallenges.description: The Professor's secret lab is hidden underground! From the crime scene, go 9 meters north and 12 meters east. What's the direct distance to the entrance?

availableChallenges.title: The Secret Pattern
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler left a coded sequence: 7, 12, 17, 22, ... What is the 8th term? This arithmetic sequence holds the key to his research location!

availableChallenges.description: CSI found a muddy footprint! It's trapezoidal with parallel sides of 12 cm and 8 cm, and height 15 cm. Calculate the area to match it with suspect shoe sizes.

availableChallenges.title: The Triangular Clue
availableChallenges.description: Hidden in the lab, you find a triangular piece of paper with two angles marked: 42° and 63°. The third angle contains the next clue!

availableChallenges.title: The Hidden Safe
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler hid his most important research in a safe. The combination is the positive solution to x2 − 7x + 12 = 0.

availableChallenges.title: The Getaway Route
availableChallenges.description: Security cameras tracked the suspect from the museum (2, 5) to the parking lot (8, 17). Calculate the slope of their escape route.

availableChallenges.title: The Suspect's Age
availableChallenges.description: A witness says: "The suspect's age plus 12 equals three times their age minus 8." Solve for the suspect's age: x + 12 = 3x − 8

availableChallenges.title: Decoding the Timestamp
availableChallenges.description: The security system shows a coded timestamp: 4 × (7 + 3) − 23. Decode this to find what hour (in 24h format) the break-in occurred.

availableChallenges.title: The Crime Scene
availableChallenges.description: Detective, you arrive at Professor Euler's lab to find chaos! There are 15 books scattered, 8 papers torn, and 3 coffee cups spilled. To access the security footage, enter the total number of disturbed items.

availableChallenges.title: Case Closed
availableChallenges.description: Congratulations, Detective! You've solved the case. The stolen formula was for calculating the volume of a cylinder. Professor Euler's prototype has radius 5 cm and height 12 cm. What's its volume? Express as kπ (e.g., 300π).

availableChallenges.title: The Mastermind's Identity
availableChallenges.description: You've gathered all clues! The mastermind's secret number is: (Age from clue 3) × (Missing angle from clue 6) ÷ (Slope from clue 4). Calculate their identification number!

availableChallenges.title: The Final Distance
availableChallenges.description: The Professor's secret lab is hidden underground! From the crime scene, go 9 meters north and 12 meters east. What's the direct distance to the entrance?

availableChallenges.title: The Secret Pattern
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler left a coded sequence: 7, 12, 17, 22, ... What is the 8th term? This arithmetic sequence holds the key to his research location!

availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler hid his most important research in a safe. The combination is the positive solution to x2 − 7x + 12 = 0.

availableChallenges.title: The Getaway Route
availableChallenges.description: Security cameras tracked the suspect from the museum (2, 5) to the parking lot (8, 17). Calculate the slope of their escape route.

availableChallenges.title: The Suspect's Age
availableChallenges.description: A witness says: "The suspect's age plus 12 equals three times their age minus 8." Solve for the suspect's age: x + 12 = 3x − 8

availableChallenges.title: Decoding the Timestamp
availableChallenges.description: The security system shows a coded timestamp: 4 × (7 + 3) − 23. Decode this to find what hour (in 24h format) the break-in occurred.

availableChallenges.title: The Crime Scene
availableChallenges.description: Detective, you arrive at Professor Euler's lab to find chaos! There are 15 books scattered, 8 papers torn, and 3 coffee cups spilled. To access the security footage, enter the total number of disturbed items.

availableChallenges.title: Case Closed
availableChallenges.description: Congratulations, Detective! You've solved the case. The stolen formula was for calculating the volume of a cylinder. Professor Euler's prototype has radius 5 cm and height 12 cm. What's its volume? Express as kπ (e.g., 300π).

availableChallenges.title: The Mastermind's Identity
availableChallenges.description: You've gathered all clues! The mastermind's secret number is: (Age from clue 3) × (Missing angle from clue 6) ÷ (Slope from clue 4). Calculate their identification number!

availableChallenges.title: The Final Distance
availableChallenges.description: The Professor's secret lab is hidden underground! From the crime scene, go 9 meters north and 12 meters east. What's the direct distance to the entrance?

availableChallenges.title: The Secret Pattern
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler left a coded sequence: 7, 12, 17, 22, ... What is the 8th term? This arithmetic sequence holds the key to his research location!

availableChallenges.title: The Compound Conspiracy
availableChallenges.description: The suspect's offshore account started with $5000 and grew at 8% compounded annually for 3 years. Calculate the final amount to track their wealth.

availableChallenges.title: The Ransom Money
availableChallenges.description: The stolen research was worth $2000. If invested at 6% simple interest for 4 years, how much interest would it have earned? This might be the thief's motive!

availableChallenges.title: The Evidence Locker
availableChallenges.description: Evidence weights (grams): 45, 23, 67, 34, 45, 78, 23. Find the median weight to organize the evidence locker.

availableChallenges.description: A witness says: "The suspect's age plus 12 equals three times their age minus 8." Solve for the suspect's age: x + 12 = 3x − 8

availableChallenges.title: Decoding the Timestamp
availableChallenges.description: The security system shows a coded timestamp: 4 × (7 + 3) − 23. Decode this to find what hour (in 24h format) the break-in occurred.

availableChallenges.title: The Crime Scene
availableChallenges.description: Detective, you arrive at Professor Euler's lab to find chaos! There are 15 books scattered, 8 papers torn, and 3 coffee cups spilled. To access the security footage, enter the total number of disturbed items.

availableChallenges.title: Case Closed
availableChallenges.description: Congratulations, Detective! You've solved the case. The stolen formula was for calculating the volume of a cylinder. Professor Euler's prototype has radius 5 cm and height 12 cm. What's its volume? Express as kπ (e.g., 300π).

availableChallenges.title: The Mastermind's Identity
availableChallenges.description: You've gathered all clues! The mastermind's secret number is: (Age from clue 3) × (Missing angle from clue 6) ÷ (Slope from clue 4). Calculate their identification number!

availableChallenges.title: The Final Distance
availableChallenges.description: The Professor's secret lab is hidden underground! From the crime scene, go 9 meters north and 12 meters east. What's the direct distance to the entrance?

availableChallenges.title: The Secret Pattern
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler left a coded sequence: 7, 12, 17, 22, ... What is the 8th term? This arithmetic sequence holds the key to his research location!

availableChallenges.title: The Compound Conspiracy
availableChallenges.description: The suspect's offshore account started with $5000 and grew at 8% compounded annually for 3 years. Calculate the final amount to track their wealth.

availableChallenges.title: The Ransom Money
availableChallenges.description: The stolen research was worth $2000. If invested at 6% simple interest for 4 years, how much interest would it have earned? This might be the thief's motive!

availableChallenges.title: The Evidence Locker
availableChallenges.description: Evidence weights (grams): 45, 23, 67, 34, 45, 78, 23. Find the median weight to organize the evidence locker.

availableChallenges.title: The Probability of Guilt
availableChallenges.description: In the suspect database: 3 have criminal records, 7 have alibis, 5 are missing. What's the probability of randomly selecting someone with a criminal record? Submit as a simplified fraction.

availableChallenges.title: The Footprint Area
availableChallenges.description: CSI found a muddy footprint! It's trapezoidal with parallel sides of 12 cm and 8 cm, and height 15 cm. Calculate the area to match it with suspect shoe sizes.

availableChallenges.title: The Triangular Clue
availableChallenges.description: Hidden in the lab, you find a triangular piece of paper with two angles marked: 42° and 63°. The third angle contains the next clue!

availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler hid his most important research in a safe. The combination is the positive solution to x2 − 7x + 12 = 0.

availableChallenges.description: Detective, you arrive at Professor Euler's lab to find chaos! There are 15 books scattered, 8 papers torn, and 3 coffee cups spilled. To access the security footage, enter the total number of disturbed items.

availableChallenges.title: Case Closed
availableChallenges.description: Congratulations, Detective! You've solved the case. The stolen formula was for calculating the volume of a cylinder. Professor Euler's prototype has radius 5 cm and height 12 cm. What's its volume? Express as kπ (e.g., 300π).

availableChallenges.title: The Mastermind's Identity
availableChallenges.description: You've gathered all clues! The mastermind's secret number is: (Age from clue 3) × (Missing angle from clue 6) ÷ (Slope from clue 4). Calculate their identification number!

availableChallenges.title: The Final Distance
availableChallenges.description: The Professor's secret lab is hidden underground! From the crime scene, go 9 meters north and 12 meters east. What's the direct distance to the entrance?

availableChallenges.title: The Secret Pattern
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler left a coded sequence: 7, 12, 17, 22, ... What is the 8th term? This arithmetic sequence holds the key to his research location!

availableChallenges.title: The Compound Conspiracy
availableChallenges.description: The suspect's offshore account started with $5000 and grew at 8% compounded annually for 3 years. Calculate the final amount to track their wealth.

availableChallenges.title: The Ransom Money
availableChallenges.description: The stolen research was worth $2000. If invested at 6% simple interest for 4 years, how much interest would it have earned? This might be the thief's motive!

availableChallenges.title: The Evidence Locker
availableChallenges.description: Evidence weights (grams): 45, 23, 67, 34, 45, 78, 23. Find the median weight to organize the evidence locker.

availableChallenges.description: In the suspect database: 3 have criminal records, 7 have alibis, 5 are missing. What's the probability of randomly selecting someone with a criminal record? Submit as a simplified fraction.

availableChallenges.title: The Footprint Area
availableChallenges.description: CSI found a muddy footprint! It's trapezoidal with parallel sides of 12 cm and 8 cm, and height 15 cm. Calculate the area to match it with suspect shoe sizes.

availableChallenges.description: Hidden in the lab, you find a triangular piece of paper with two angles marked: 42° and 63°. The third angle contains the next clue!

availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler hid his most important research in a safe. The combination is the positive solution to x2 − 7x + 12 = 0.

availableChallenges.description: Security cameras tracked the suspect from the museum (2, 5) to the parking lot (8, 17). Calculate the slope of their escape route.

availableChallenges.description: You've gathered all clues! The mastermind's secret number is: (Age from clue 3) × (Missing angle from clue 6) ÷ (Slope from clue 4). Calculate their identification number!

availableChallenges.title: The Final Distance
availableChallenges.description: The Professor's secret lab is hidden underground! From the crime scene, go 9 meters north and 12 meters east. What's the direct distance to the entrance?

availableChallenges.title: The Secret Pattern
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler left a coded sequence: 7, 12, 17, 22, ... What is the 8th term? This arithmetic sequence holds the key to his research location!

availableChallenges.title: The Compound Conspiracy
availableChallenges.description: The suspect's offshore account started with $5000 and grew at 8% compounded annually for 3 years. Calculate the final amount to track their wealth.

availableChallenges.title: The Ransom Money
availableChallenges.description: The stolen research was worth $2000. If invested at 6% simple interest for 4 years, how much interest would it have earned? This might be the thief's motive!

availableChallenges.title: The Evidence Locker
availableChallenges.description: Evidence weights (grams): 45, 23, 67, 34, 45, 78, 23. Find the median weight to organize the evidence locker.

availableChallenges.title: The Probability of Guilt
availableChallenges.description: In the suspect database: 3 have criminal records, 7 have alibis, 5 are missing. What's the probability of randomly selecting someone with a criminal record? Submit as a simplified fraction.

availableChallenges.title: The Footprint Area
availableChallenges.description: CSI found a muddy footprint! It's trapezoidal with parallel sides of 12 cm and 8 cm, and height 15 cm. Calculate the area to match it with suspect shoe sizes.

availableChallenges.title: The Triangular Clue
availableChallenges.description: Hidden in the lab, you find a triangular piece of paper with two angles marked: 42° and 63°. The third angle contains the next clue!

availableChallenges.title: The Hidden Safe
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler hid his most important research in a safe. The combination is the positive solution to x2 − 7x + 12 = 0.

availableChallenges.title: The Getaway Route
availableChallenges.description: Security cameras tracked the suspect from the museum (2, 5) to the parking lot (8, 17). Calculate the slope of their escape route.

availableChallenges.title: The Suspect's Age
availableChallenges.description: A witness says: "The suspect's age plus 12 equals three times their age minus 8." Solve for the suspect's age: x + 12 = 3x − 8

availableChallenges.title: Decoding the Timestamp
availableChallenges.description: The security system shows a coded timestamp: 4 × (7 + 3) − 23. Decode this to find what hour (in 24h format) the break-in occurred.

availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler left a coded sequence: 7, 12, 17, 22, ... What is the 8th term? This arithmetic sequence holds the key to his research location!

availableChallenges.title: The Compound Conspiracy
availableChallenges.description: The suspect's offshore account started with $5000 and grew at 8% compounded annually for 3 years. Calculate the final amount to track their wealth.

availableChallenges.title: The Ransom Money
availableChallenges.description: The stolen research was worth $2000. If invested at 6% simple interest for 4 years, how much interest would it have earned? This might be the thief's motive!

availableChallenges.title: The Evidence Locker
availableChallenges.description: Evidence weights (grams): 45, 23, 67, 34, 45, 78, 23. Find the median weight to organize the evidence locker.

availableChallenges.title: The Probability of Guilt
availableChallenges.description: In the suspect database: 3 have criminal records, 7 have alibis, 5 are missing. What's the probability of randomly selecting someone with a criminal record? Submit as a simplified fraction.

availableChallenges.title: The Footprint Area
availableChallenges.description: CSI found a muddy footprint! It's trapezoidal with parallel sides of 12 cm and 8 cm, and height 15 cm. Calculate the area to match it with suspect shoe sizes.

availableChallenges.title: The Triangular Clue
availableChallenges.description: Hidden in the lab, you find a triangular piece of paper with two angles marked: 42° and 63°. The third angle contains the next clue!

availableChallenges.title: The Hidden Safe
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler hid his most important research in a safe. The combination is the positive solution to x2 − 7x + 12 = 0.

availableChallenges.title: The Getaway Route
availableChallenges.description: Security cameras tracked the suspect from the museum (2, 5) to the parking lot (8, 17). Calculate the slope of their escape route.

availableChallenges.title: The Suspect's Age
availableChallenges.description: A witness says: "The suspect's age plus 12 equals three times their age minus 8." Solve for the suspect's age: x + 12 = 3x − 8

availableChallenges.title: Decoding the Timestamp
availableChallenges.description: The security system shows a coded timestamp: 4 × (7 + 3) − 23. Decode this to find what hour (in 24h format) the break-in occurred.

availableChallenges.title: The Evidence Locker
availableChallenges.description: Evidence weights (grams): 45, 23, 67, 34, 45, 78, 23. Find the median weight to organize the evidence locker.

availableChallenges.title: The Probability of Guilt
availableChallenges.description: In the suspect database: 3 have criminal records, 7 have alibis, 5 are missing. What's the probability of randomly selecting someone with a criminal record? Submit as a simplified fraction.

availableChallenges.title: The Footprint Area
availableChallenges.description: CSI found a muddy footprint! It's trapezoidal with parallel sides of 12 cm and 8 cm, and height 15 cm. Calculate the area to match it with suspect shoe sizes.

availableChallenges.title: The Triangular Clue
availableChallenges.description: Hidden in the lab, you find a triangular piece of paper with two angles marked: 42° and 63°. The third angle contains the next clue!

availableChallenges.title: The Hidden Safe
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler hid his most important research in a safe. The combination is the positive solution to x2 − 7x + 12 = 0.

availableChallenges.title: The Getaway Route
availableChallenges.description: Security cameras tracked the suspect from the museum (2, 5) to the parking lot (8, 17). Calculate the slope of their escape route.

availableChallenges.title: The Suspect's Age
availableChallenges.description: A witness says: "The suspect's age plus 12 equals three times their age minus 8." Solve for the suspect's age: x + 12 = 3x − 8

availableChallenges.title: Decoding the Timestamp
availableChallenges.description: The security system shows a coded timestamp: 4 × (7 + 3) − 23. Decode this to find what hour (in 24h format) the break-in occurred.

availableChallenges.title: The Crime Scene
availableChallenges.description: Detective, you arrive at Professor Euler's lab to find chaos! There are 15 books scattered, 8 papers torn, and 3 coffee cups spilled. To access the security footage, enter the total number of disturbed items.

availableChallenges.title: Case Closed
availableChallenges.description: Congratulations, Detective! You've solved the case. The stolen formula was for calculating the volume of a cylinder. Professor Euler's prototype has radius 5 cm and height 12 cm. What's its volume? Express as kπ (e.g., 300π).

availableChallenges.title: The Mastermind's Identity
availableChallenges.description: You've gathered all clues! The mastermind's secret number is: (Age from clue 3) × (Missing angle from clue 6) ÷ (Slope from clue 4). Calculate their identification number!

availableChallenges.title: The Final Distance
availableChallenges.description: The Professor's secret lab is hidden underground! From the crime scene, go 9 meters north and 12 meters east. What's the direct distance to the entrance?

availableChallenges.title: The Secret Pattern
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler left a coded sequence: 7, 12, 17, 22, ... What is the 8th term? This arithmetic sequence holds the key to his research location!

availableChallenges.description: CSI found a muddy footprint! It's trapezoidal with parallel sides of 12 cm and 8 cm, and height 15 cm. Calculate the area to match it with suspect shoe sizes.

availableChallenges.title: The Triangular Clue
availableChallenges.description: Hidden in the lab, you find a triangular piece of paper with two angles marked: 42° and 63°. The third angle contains the next clue!

availableChallenges.title: The Hidden Safe
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler hid his most important research in a safe. The combination is the positive solution to x2 − 7x + 12 = 0.

availableChallenges.title: The Getaway Route
availableChallenges.description: Security cameras tracked the suspect from the museum (2, 5) to the parking lot (8, 17). Calculate the slope of their escape route.

availableChallenges.title: The Suspect's Age
availableChallenges.description: A witness says: "The suspect's age plus 12 equals three times their age minus 8." Solve for the suspect's age: x + 12 = 3x − 8

availableChallenges.title: Decoding the Timestamp
availableChallenges.description: The security system shows a coded timestamp: 4 × (7 + 3) − 23. Decode this to find what hour (in 24h format) the break-in occurred.

availableChallenges.title: The Crime Scene
availableChallenges.description: Detective, you arrive at Professor Euler's lab to find chaos! There are 15 books scattered, 8 papers torn, and 3 coffee cups spilled. To access the security footage, enter the total number of disturbed items.

availableChallenges.title: Case Closed
availableChallenges.description: Congratulations, Detective! You've solved the case. The stolen formula was for calculating the volume of a cylinder. Professor Euler's prototype has radius 5 cm and height 12 cm. What's its volume? Express as kπ (e.g., 300π).

availableChallenges.title: The Mastermind's Identity
availableChallenges.description: You've gathered all clues! The mastermind's secret number is: (Age from clue 3) × (Missing angle from clue 6) ÷ (Slope from clue 4). Calculate their identification number!

availableChallenges.title: The Final Distance
availableChallenges.description: The Professor's secret lab is hidden underground! From the crime scene, go 9 meters north and 12 meters east. What's the direct distance to the entrance?

availableChallenges.title: The Secret Pattern
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler left a coded sequence: 7, 12, 17, 22, ... What is the 8th term? This arithmetic sequence holds the key to his research location!

availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler hid his most important research in a safe. The combination is the positive solution to x2 − 7x + 12 = 0.

availableChallenges.title: The Getaway Route
availableChallenges.description: Security cameras tracked the suspect from the museum (2, 5) to the parking lot (8, 17). Calculate the slope of their escape route.

availableChallenges.title: The Suspect's Age
availableChallenges.description: A witness says: "The suspect's age plus 12 equals three times their age minus 8." Solve for the suspect's age: x + 12 = 3x − 8

availableChallenges.title: Decoding the Timestamp
availableChallenges.description: The security system shows a coded timestamp: 4 × (7 + 3) − 23. Decode this to find what hour (in 24h format) the break-in occurred.

availableChallenges.title: The Crime Scene
availableChallenges.description: Detective, you arrive at Professor Euler's lab to find chaos! There are 15 books scattered, 8 papers torn, and 3 coffee cups spilled. To access the security footage, enter the total number of disturbed items.

availableChallenges.title: Case Closed
availableChallenges.description: Congratulations, Detective! You've solved the case. The stolen formula was for calculating the volume of a cylinder. Professor Euler's prototype has radius 5 cm and height 12 cm. What's its volume? Express as kπ (e.g., 300π).

availableChallenges.title: The Mastermind's Identity
availableChallenges.description: You've gathered all clues! The mastermind's secret number is: (Age from clue 3) × (Missing angle from clue 6) ÷ (Slope from clue 4). Calculate their identification number!

availableChallenges.title: The Final Distance
availableChallenges.description: The Professor's secret lab is hidden underground! From the crime scene, go 9 meters north and 12 meters east. What's the direct distance to the entrance?

availableChallenges.title: The Secret Pattern
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler left a coded sequence: 7, 12, 17, 22, ... What is the 8th term? This arithmetic sequence holds the key to his research location!

availableChallenges.title: The Compound Conspiracy
availableChallenges.description: The suspect's offshore account started with $5000 and grew at 8% compounded annually for 3 years. Calculate the final amount to track their wealth.

availableChallenges.title: The Ransom Money
availableChallenges.description: The stolen research was worth $2000. If invested at 6% simple interest for 4 years, how much interest would it have earned? This might be the thief's motive!

availableChallenges.title: The Evidence Locker
availableChallenges.description: Evidence weights (grams): 45, 23, 67, 34, 45, 78, 23. Find the median weight to organize the evidence locker.

availableChallenges.description: A witness says: "The suspect's age plus 12 equals three times their age minus 8." Solve for the suspect's age: x + 12 = 3x − 8

availableChallenges.title: Decoding the Timestamp
availableChallenges.description: The security system shows a coded timestamp: 4 × (7 + 3) − 23. Decode this to find what hour (in 24h format) the break-in occurred.

availableChallenges.title: The Crime Scene
availableChallenges.description: Detective, you arrive at Professor Euler's lab to find chaos! There are 15 books scattered, 8 papers torn, and 3 coffee cups spilled. To access the security footage, enter the total number of disturbed items.

availableChallenges.title: Case Closed
availableChallenges.description: Congratulations, Detective! You've solved the case. The stolen formula was for calculating the volume of a cylinder. Professor Euler's prototype has radius 5 cm and height 12 cm. What's its volume? Express as kπ (e.g., 300π).

availableChallenges.title: The Mastermind's Identity
availableChallenges.description: You've gathered all clues! The mastermind's secret number is: (Age from clue 3) × (Missing angle from clue 6) ÷ (Slope from clue 4). Calculate their identification number!

availableChallenges.title: The Final Distance
availableChallenges.description: The Professor's secret lab is hidden underground! From the crime scene, go 9 meters north and 12 meters east. What's the direct distance to the entrance?

availableChallenges.title: The Secret Pattern
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler left a coded sequence: 7, 12, 17, 22, ... What is the 8th term? This arithmetic sequence holds the key to his research location!

availableChallenges.title: The Compound Conspiracy
availableChallenges.description: The suspect's offshore account started with $5000 and grew at 8% compounded annually for 3 years. Calculate the final amount to track their wealth.

availableChallenges.title: The Ransom Money
availableChallenges.description: The stolen research was worth $2000. If invested at 6% simple interest for 4 years, how much interest would it have earned? This might be the thief's motive!

availableChallenges.title: The Evidence Locker
availableChallenges.description: Evidence weights (grams): 45, 23, 67, 34, 45, 78, 23. Find the median weight to organize the evidence locker.

availableChallenges.title: The Probability of Guilt
availableChallenges.description: In the suspect database: 3 have criminal records, 7 have alibis, 5 are missing. What's the probability of randomly selecting someone with a criminal record? Submit as a simplified fraction.

availableChallenges.title: The Footprint Area
availableChallenges.description: CSI found a muddy footprint! It's trapezoidal with parallel sides of 12 cm and 8 cm, and height 15 cm. Calculate the area to match it with suspect shoe sizes.

availableChallenges.title: The Triangular Clue
availableChallenges.description: Hidden in the lab, you find a triangular piece of paper with two angles marked: 42° and 63°. The third angle contains the next clue!

availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler hid his most important research in a safe. The combination is the positive solution to x2 − 7x + 12 = 0.

availableChallenges.description: Detective, you arrive at Professor Euler's lab to find chaos! There are 15 books scattered, 8 papers torn, and 3 coffee cups spilled. To access the security footage, enter the total number of disturbed items.

availableChallenges.title: Case Closed
availableChallenges.description: Congratulations, Detective! You've solved the case. The stolen formula was for calculating the volume of a cylinder. Professor Euler's prototype has radius 5 cm and height 12 cm. What's its volume? Express as kπ (e.g., 300π).

availableChallenges.title: The Mastermind's Identity
availableChallenges.description: You've gathered all clues! The mastermind's secret number is: (Age from clue 3) × (Missing angle from clue 6) ÷ (Slope from clue 4). Calculate their identification number!

availableChallenges.title: The Final Distance
availableChallenges.description: The Professor's secret lab is hidden underground! From the crime scene, go 9 meters north and 12 meters east. What's the direct distance to the entrance?

availableChallenges.title: The Secret Pattern
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler left a coded sequence: 7, 12, 17, 22, ... What is the 8th term? This arithmetic sequence holds the key to his research location!

availableChallenges.title: The Compound Conspiracy
availableChallenges.description: The suspect's offshore account started with $5000 and grew at 8% compounded annually for 3 years. Calculate the final amount to track their wealth.

availableChallenges.title: The Ransom Money
availableChallenges.description: The stolen research was worth $2000. If invested at 6% simple interest for 4 years, how much interest would it have earned? This might be the thief's motive!

availableChallenges.title: The Evidence Locker
availableChallenges.description: Evidence weights (grams): 45, 23, 67, 34, 45, 78, 23. Find the median weight to organize the evidence locker.

availableChallenges.description: In the suspect database: 3 have criminal records, 7 have alibis, 5 are missing. What's the probability of randomly selecting someone with a criminal record? Submit as a simplified fraction.

availableChallenges.title: The Footprint Area
availableChallenges.description: CSI found a muddy footprint! It's trapezoidal with parallel sides of 12 cm and 8 cm, and height 15 cm. Calculate the area to match it with suspect shoe sizes.

availableChallenges.description: Hidden in the lab, you find a triangular piece of paper with two angles marked: 42° and 63°. The third angle contains the next clue!

availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler hid his most important research in a safe. The combination is the positive solution to x2 − 7x + 12 = 0.

availableChallenges.description: Security cameras tracked the suspect from the museum (2, 5) to the parking lot (8, 17). Calculate the slope of their escape route.

availableChallenges.description: You've gathered all clues! The mastermind's secret number is: (Age from clue 3) × (Missing angle from clue 6) ÷ (Slope from clue 4). Calculate their identification number!

availableChallenges.title: The Final Distance
availableChallenges.description: The Professor's secret lab is hidden underground! From the crime scene, go 9 meters north and 12 meters east. What's the direct distance to the entrance?

availableChallenges.title: The Secret Pattern
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler left a coded sequence: 7, 12, 17, 22, ... What is the 8th term? This arithmetic sequence holds the key to his research location!

availableChallenges.title: The Compound Conspiracy
availableChallenges.description: The suspect's offshore account started with $5000 and grew at 8% compounded annually for 3 years. Calculate the final amount to track their wealth.

availableChallenges.title: The Ransom Money
availableChallenges.description: The stolen research was worth $2000. If invested at 6% simple interest for 4 years, how much interest would it have earned? This might be the thief's motive!

availableChallenges.title: The Evidence Locker
availableChallenges.description: Evidence weights (grams): 45, 23, 67, 34, 45, 78, 23. Find the median weight to organize the evidence locker.

availableChallenges.title: The Probability of Guilt
availableChallenges.description: In the suspect database: 3 have criminal records, 7 have alibis, 5 are missing. What's the probability of randomly selecting someone with a criminal record? Submit as a simplified fraction.

availableChallenges.title: The Footprint Area
availableChallenges.description: CSI found a muddy footprint! It's trapezoidal with parallel sides of 12 cm and 8 cm, and height 15 cm. Calculate the area to match it with suspect shoe sizes.

availableChallenges.title: The Triangular Clue
availableChallenges.description: Hidden in the lab, you find a triangular piece of paper with two angles marked: 42° and 63°. The third angle contains the next clue!

availableChallenges.title: The Hidden Safe
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler hid his most important research in a safe. The combination is the positive solution to x2 − 7x + 12 = 0.

availableChallenges.title: The Getaway Route
availableChallenges.description: Security cameras tracked the suspect from the museum (2, 5) to the parking lot (8, 17). Calculate the slope of their escape route.

availableChallenges.title: The Suspect's Age
availableChallenges.description: A witness says: "The suspect's age plus 12 equals three times their age minus 8." Solve for the suspect's age: x + 12 = 3x − 8

availableChallenges.title: Decoding the Timestamp
availableChallenges.description: The security system shows a coded timestamp: 4 × (7 + 3) − 23. Decode this to find what hour (in 24h format) the break-in occurred.

availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler left a coded sequence: 7, 12, 17, 22, ... What is the 8th term? This arithmetic sequence holds the key to his research location!

availableChallenges.title: The Compound Conspiracy
availableChallenges.description: The suspect's offshore account started with $5000 and grew at 8% compounded annually for 3 years. Calculate the final amount to track their wealth.

availableChallenges.title: The Ransom Money
availableChallenges.description: The stolen research was worth $2000. If invested at 6% simple interest for 4 years, how much interest would it have earned? This might be the thief's motive!

availableChallenges.title: The Evidence Locker
availableChallenges.description: Evidence weights (grams): 45, 23, 67, 34, 45, 78, 23. Find the median weight to organize the evidence locker.

availableChallenges.title: The Probability of Guilt
availableChallenges.description: In the suspect database: 3 have criminal records, 7 have alibis, 5 are missing. What's the probability of randomly selecting someone with a criminal record? Submit as a simplified fraction.

availableChallenges.title: The Footprint Area
availableChallenges.description: CSI found a muddy footprint! It's trapezoidal with parallel sides of 12 cm and 8 cm, and height 15 cm. Calculate the area to match it with suspect shoe sizes.

availableChallenges.title: The Triangular Clue
availableChallenges.description: Hidden in the lab, you find a triangular piece of paper with two angles marked: 42° and 63°. The third angle contains the next clue!

availableChallenges.title: The Hidden Safe
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler hid his most important research in a safe. The combination is the positive solution to x2 − 7x + 12 = 0.

availableChallenges.title: The Getaway Route
availableChallenges.description: Security cameras tracked the suspect from the museum (2, 5) to the parking lot (8, 17). Calculate the slope of their escape route.

availableChallenges.title: The Suspect's Age
availableChallenges.description: A witness says: "The suspect's age plus 12 equals three times their age minus 8." Solve for the suspect's age: x + 12 = 3x − 8

availableChallenges.title: Decoding the Timestamp
availableChallenges.description: The security system shows a coded timestamp: 4 × (7 + 3) − 23. Decode this to find what hour (in 24h format) the break-in occurred.

availableChallenges.title: The Evidence Locker
availableChallenges.description: Evidence weights (grams): 45, 23, 67, 34, 45, 78, 23. Find the median weight to organize the evidence locker.

availableChallenges.title: The Probability of Guilt
availableChallenges.description: In the suspect database: 3 have criminal records, 7 have alibis, 5 are missing. What's the probability of randomly selecting someone with a criminal record? Submit as a simplified fraction.

availableChallenges.title: The Footprint Area
availableChallenges.description: CSI found a muddy footprint! It's trapezoidal with parallel sides of 12 cm and 8 cm, and height 15 cm. Calculate the area to match it with suspect shoe sizes.

availableChallenges.title: The Triangular Clue
availableChallenges.description: Hidden in the lab, you find a triangular piece of paper with two angles marked: 42° and 63°. The third angle contains the next clue!

availableChallenges.title: The Hidden Safe
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler hid his most important research in a safe. The combination is the positive solution to x2 − 7x + 12 = 0.

availableChallenges.title: The Getaway Route
availableChallenges.description: Security cameras tracked the suspect from the museum (2, 5) to the parking lot (8, 17). Calculate the slope of their escape route.

availableChallenges.title: The Suspect's Age
availableChallenges.description: A witness says: "The suspect's age plus 12 equals three times their age minus 8." Solve for the suspect's age: x + 12 = 3x − 8

availableChallenges.title: Decoding the Timestamp
availableChallenges.description: The security system shows a coded timestamp: 4 × (7 + 3) − 23. Decode this to find what hour (in 24h format) the break-in occurred.

availableChallenges.title: The Crime Scene
availableChallenges.description: Detective, you arrive at Professor Euler's lab to find chaos! There are 15 books scattered, 8 papers torn, and 3 coffee cups spilled. To access the security footage, enter the total number of disturbed items.

availableChallenges.title: Case Closed
availableChallenges.description: Congratulations, Detective! You've solved the case. The stolen formula was for calculating the volume of a cylinder. Professor Euler's prototype has radius 5 cm and height 12 cm. What's its volume? Express as kπ (e.g., 300π).

availableChallenges.title: The Mastermind's Identity
availableChallenges.description: You've gathered all clues! The mastermind's secret number is: (Age from clue 3) × (Missing angle from clue 6) ÷ (Slope from clue 4). Calculate their identification number!

availableChallenges.title: The Final Distance
availableChallenges.description: The Professor's secret lab is hidden underground! From the crime scene, go 9 meters north and 12 meters east. What's the direct distance to the entrance?

availableChallenges.title: The Secret Pattern
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler left a coded sequence: 7, 12, 17, 22, ... What is the 8th term? This arithmetic sequence holds the key to his research location!

availableChallenges.description: CSI found a muddy footprint! It's trapezoidal with parallel sides of 12 cm and 8 cm, and height 15 cm. Calculate the area to match it with suspect shoe sizes.

availableChallenges.title: The Triangular Clue
availableChallenges.description: Hidden in the lab, you find a triangular piece of paper with two angles marked: 42° and 63°. The third angle contains the next clue!

availableChallenges.title: The Hidden Safe
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler hid his most important research in a safe. The combination is the positive solution to x2 − 7x + 12 = 0.

availableChallenges.title: The Getaway Route
availableChallenges.description: Security cameras tracked the suspect from the museum (2, 5) to the parking lot (8, 17). Calculate the slope of their escape route.

availableChallenges.title: The Suspect's Age
availableChallenges.description: A witness says: "The suspect's age plus 12 equals three times their age minus 8." Solve for the suspect's age: x + 12 = 3x − 8

availableChallenges.title: Decoding the Timestamp
availableChallenges.description: The security system shows a coded timestamp: 4 × (7 + 3) − 23. Decode this to find what hour (in 24h format) the break-in occurred.

availableChallenges.title: The Crime Scene
availableChallenges.description: Detective, you arrive at Professor Euler's lab to find chaos! There are 15 books scattered, 8 papers torn, and 3 coffee cups spilled. To access the security footage, enter the total number of disturbed items.

availableChallenges.title: Case Closed
availableChallenges.description: Congratulations, Detective! You've solved the case. The stolen formula was for calculating the volume of a cylinder. Professor Euler's prototype has radius 5 cm and height 12 cm. What's its volume? Express as kπ (e.g., 300π).

availableChallenges.title: The Mastermind's Identity
availableChallenges.description: You've gathered all clues! The mastermind's secret number is: (Age from clue 3) × (Missing angle from clue 6) ÷ (Slope from clue 4). Calculate their identification number!

availableChallenges.title: The Final Distance
availableChallenges.description: The Professor's secret lab is hidden underground! From the crime scene, go 9 meters north and 12 meters east. What's the direct distance to the entrance?

availableChallenges.title: The Secret Pattern
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler left a coded sequence: 7, 12, 17, 22, ... What is the 8th term? This arithmetic sequence holds the key to his research location!

availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler hid his most important research in a safe. The combination is the positive solution to x2 − 7x + 12 = 0.

availableChallenges.title: The Getaway Route
availableChallenges.description: Security cameras tracked the suspect from the museum (2, 5) to the parking lot (8, 17). Calculate the slope of their escape route.

availableChallenges.title: The Suspect's Age
availableChallenges.description: A witness says: "The suspect's age plus 12 equals three times their age minus 8." Solve for the suspect's age: x + 12 = 3x − 8

availableChallenges.title: Decoding the Timestamp
availableChallenges.description: The security system shows a coded timestamp: 4 × (7 + 3) − 23. Decode this to find what hour (in 24h format) the break-in occurred.

availableChallenges.title: The Crime Scene
availableChallenges.description: Detective, you arrive at Professor Euler's lab to find chaos! There are 15 books scattered, 8 papers torn, and 3 coffee cups spilled. To access the security footage, enter the total number of disturbed items.

availableChallenges.title: Case Closed
availableChallenges.description: Congratulations, Detective! You've solved the case. The stolen formula was for calculating the volume of a cylinder. Professor Euler's prototype has radius 5 cm and height 12 cm. What's its volume? Express as kπ (e.g., 300π).

availableChallenges.title: The Mastermind's Identity
availableChallenges.description: You've gathered all clues! The mastermind's secret number is: (Age from clue 3) × (Missing angle from clue 6) ÷ (Slope from clue 4). Calculate their identification number!

availableChallenges.title: The Final Distance
availableChallenges.description: The Professor's secret lab is hidden underground! From the crime scene, go 9 meters north and 12 meters east. What's the direct distance to the entrance?

availableChallenges.title: The Secret Pattern
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler left a coded sequence: 7, 12, 17, 22, ... What is the 8th term? This arithmetic sequence holds the key to his research location!

availableChallenges.title: The Compound Conspiracy
availableChallenges.description: The suspect's offshore account started with $5000 and grew at 8% compounded annually for 3 years. Calculate the final amount to track their wealth.

availableChallenges.title: The Ransom Money
availableChallenges.description: The stolen research was worth $2000. If invested at 6% simple interest for 4 years, how much interest would it have earned? This might be the thief's motive!

availableChallenges.title: The Evidence Locker
availableChallenges.description: Evidence weights (grams): 45, 23, 67, 34, 45, 78, 23. Find the median weight to organize the evidence locker.

availableChallenges.description: A witness says: "The suspect's age plus 12 equals three times their age minus 8." Solve for the suspect's age: x + 12 = 3x − 8

availableChallenges.title: Decoding the Timestamp
availableChallenges.description: The security system shows a coded timestamp: 4 × (7 + 3) − 23. Decode this to find what hour (in 24h format) the break-in occurred.

availableChallenges.title: The Crime Scene
availableChallenges.description: Detective, you arrive at Professor Euler's lab to find chaos! There are 15 books scattered, 8 papers torn, and 3 coffee cups spilled. To access the security footage, enter the total number of disturbed items.

availableChallenges.title: Case Closed
availableChallenges.description: Congratulations, Detective! You've solved the case. The stolen formula was for calculating the volume of a cylinder. Professor Euler's prototype has radius 5 cm and height 12 cm. What's its volume? Express as kπ (e.g., 300π).

availableChallenges.title: The Mastermind's Identity
availableChallenges.description: You've gathered all clues! The mastermind's secret number is: (Age from clue 3) × (Missing angle from clue 6) ÷ (Slope from clue 4). Calculate their identification number!

availableChallenges.title: The Final Distance
availableChallenges.description: The Professor's secret lab is hidden underground! From the crime scene, go 9 meters north and 12 meters east. What's the direct distance to the entrance?

availableChallenges.title: The Secret Pattern
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler left a coded sequence: 7, 12, 17, 22, ... What is the 8th term? This arithmetic sequence holds the key to his research location!

availableChallenges.title: The Compound Conspiracy
availableChallenges.description: The suspect's offshore account started with $5000 and grew at 8% compounded annually for 3 years. Calculate the final amount to track their wealth.

availableChallenges.title: The Ransom Money
availableChallenges.description: The stolen research was worth $2000. If invested at 6% simple interest for 4 years, how much interest would it have earned? This might be the thief's motive!

availableChallenges.title: The Evidence Locker
availableChallenges.description: Evidence weights (grams): 45, 23, 67, 34, 45, 78, 23. Find the median weight to organize the evidence locker.

availableChallenges.title: The Probability of Guilt
availableChallenges.description: In the suspect database: 3 have criminal records, 7 have alibis, 5 are missing. What's the probability of randomly selecting someone with a criminal record? Submit as a simplified fraction.

availableChallenges.title: The Footprint Area
availableChallenges.description: CSI found a muddy footprint! It's trapezoidal with parallel sides of 12 cm and 8 cm, and height 15 cm. Calculate the area to match it with suspect shoe sizes.

availableChallenges.title: The Triangular Clue
availableChallenges.description: Hidden in the lab, you find a triangular piece of paper with two angles marked: 42° and 63°. The third angle contains the next clue!

availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler hid his most important research in a safe. The combination is the positive solution to x2 − 7x + 12 = 0.

availableChallenges.description: Detective, you arrive at Professor Euler's lab to find chaos! There are 15 books scattered, 8 papers torn, and 3 coffee cups spilled. To access the security footage, enter the total number of disturbed items.

availableChallenges.title: Case Closed
availableChallenges.description: Congratulations, Detective! You've solved the case. The stolen formula was for calculating the volume of a cylinder. Professor Euler's prototype has radius 5 cm and height 12 cm. What's its volume? Express as kπ (e.g., 300π).

availableChallenges.title: The Mastermind's Identity
availableChallenges.description: You've gathered all clues! The mastermind's secret number is: (Age from clue 3) × (Missing angle from clue 6) ÷ (Slope from clue 4). Calculate their identification number!

availableChallenges.title: The Final Distance
availableChallenges.description: The Professor's secret lab is hidden underground! From the crime scene, go 9 meters north and 12 meters east. What's the direct distance to the entrance?

availableChallenges.title: The Secret Pattern
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler left a coded sequence: 7, 12, 17, 22, ... What is the 8th term? This arithmetic sequence holds the key to his research location!

availableChallenges.title: The Compound Conspiracy
availableChallenges.description: The suspect's offshore account started with $5000 and grew at 8% compounded annually for 3 years. Calculate the final amount to track their wealth.

availableChallenges.title: The Ransom Money
availableChallenges.description: The stolen research was worth $2000. If invested at 6% simple interest for 4 years, how much interest would it have earned? This might be the thief's motive!

availableChallenges.title: The Evidence Locker
availableChallenges.description: Evidence weights (grams): 45, 23, 67, 34, 45, 78, 23. Find the median weight to organize the evidence locker.

availableChallenges.description: In the suspect database: 3 have criminal records, 7 have alibis, 5 are missing. What's the probability of randomly selecting someone with a criminal record? Submit as a simplified fraction.

availableChallenges.title: The Footprint Area
availableChallenges.description: CSI found a muddy footprint! It's trapezoidal with parallel sides of 12 cm and 8 cm, and height 15 cm. Calculate the area to match it with suspect shoe sizes.

availableChallenges.description: Hidden in the lab, you find a triangular piece of paper with two angles marked: 42° and 63°. The third angle contains the next clue!

availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler hid his most important research in a safe. The combination is the positive solution to x2 − 7x + 12 = 0.

availableChallenges.description: Security cameras tracked the suspect from the museum (2, 5) to the parking lot (8, 17). Calculate the slope of their escape route.

availableChallenges.description: You've gathered all clues! The mastermind's secret number is: (Age from clue 3) × (Missing angle from clue 6) ÷ (Slope from clue 4). Calculate their identification number!

availableChallenges.title: The Final Distance
availableChallenges.description: The Professor's secret lab is hidden underground! From the crime scene, go 9 meters north and 12 meters east. What's the direct distance to the entrance?

availableChallenges.title: The Secret Pattern
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler left a coded sequence: 7, 12, 17, 22, ... What is the 8th term? This arithmetic sequence holds the key to his research location!

availableChallenges.title: The Compound Conspiracy
availableChallenges.description: The suspect's offshore account started with $5000 and grew at 8% compounded annually for 3 years. Calculate the final amount to track their wealth.

availableChallenges.title: The Ransom Money
availableChallenges.description: The stolen research was worth $2000. If invested at 6% simple interest for 4 years, how much interest would it have earned? This might be the thief's motive!

availableChallenges.title: The Evidence Locker
availableChallenges.description: Evidence weights (grams): 45, 23, 67, 34, 45, 78, 23. Find the median weight to organize the evidence locker.

availableChallenges.title: The Probability of Guilt
availableChallenges.description: In the suspect database: 3 have criminal records, 7 have alibis, 5 are missing. What's the probability of randomly selecting someone with a criminal record? Submit as a simplified fraction.

availableChallenges.title: The Footprint Area
availableChallenges.description: CSI found a muddy footprint! It's trapezoidal with parallel sides of 12 cm and 8 cm, and height 15 cm. Calculate the area to match it with suspect shoe sizes.

availableChallenges.title: The Triangular Clue
availableChallenges.description: Hidden in the lab, you find a triangular piece of paper with two angles marked: 42° and 63°. The third angle contains the next clue!

availableChallenges.title: The Hidden Safe
availableChallenges.description: Professor Euler hid his most important research in a safe. The combination is the positive solution to x2 − 7x + 12 = 0.

availableChallenges.title: The Getaway Route
availableChallenges.description: Security cameras tracked the suspect from the museum (2, 5) to the parking lot (8, 17). Calculate the slope of their escape route.

availableChallenges.title: The Suspect's Age
availableChallenges.description: A witness says: "The suspect's age plus 12 equals three times their age minus 8." Solve for the suspect's age: x + 12 = 3x − 8

availableChallenges.title: Decoding the Timestamp
availableChallenges.description: The security system shows a coded timestamp: 4 × (7 + 3) − 23. Decode this to find what hour (in 24h format) the break-in occurred.
